name: ApexClass
summary:
The `ApexClass` object in Salesforce represents a custom Apex class within the Salesforce platform. Here is a summary of its attributes:

- **Id**: A unique identifier for the Apex class. (Type: id)
- **NamespacePrefix**: The namespace prefix associated with the Apex class. (Type: string)
- **Name**: The name of the Apex class. (Type: string)
- **ApiVersion**: The API version of the Apex class. (Type: double)
- **Status**: The status of the Apex class, which can be a picklist value such as "Active" or "Inactive". (Type: picklist)
- **IsValid**: Indicates whether the Apex class is valid. (Type: boolean)
- **BodyCrc**: A checksum for the body of the Apex class. (Type: double)
- **Body**: The actual code of the Apex class. (Type: textarea)
- **LengthWithoutComments**: The length of the Apex class code excluding comments. (Type: int)
- **CreatedDate**: The date and time when the Apex class was created. (Type: datetime)
- **CreatedById**: The ID of the user who created the Apex class. (Type: reference)
- **LastModifiedDate**: The date and time when the Apex class was last modified. (Type: datetime)
- **LastModifiedById**: The ID of the user who last modified the Apex class. (Type: reference)
- **SystemModstamp**: The date and time when the Apex class was last modified by the system. (Type: datetime)

These attributes provide a comprehensive view of the metadata and status of an Apex class in Salesforce.
label: Apex Class
